sen.j: 柄頭（つかがしら）とは刀に装着する刀装具。
sen.e: Tsuka-gashira is the equipment attached to a sword.

sen.j: 太刀身の柄端に合わせられる刀装具。
sen.e: Tsuka-gashira is the equipment of a sword which is attached to the edge of a hilt.

sen.j: 刀の切っ先と正反対の位置にあたる金属製の部品。
sen.e: It is the metal part located opposite side of a sword head.

sen.j: 古墳時代には金銀製で儀仗用の飾太刀の外装に用いられた。
sen.e: In the Kofun period (the period of ancient burial mounds), it was made of silver-gold and used for the exterior of Kazari-tachi (decorated sword).
In the Kofun period (tumulus period), it was made of gold or silver and used for the exterior of Kazari-tachi (decorated sword) for the guard.

sen.j: 特に飾太刀は柄頭の形態から環頭太刀や円頭太刀などに分類される。
sen.e: Specifically, Kazari-tachi is classified in Kanto-tachi (ring-headed sword) and Ento-tachi (round-headed sword) due to the form of Tsuka-gashira.

sen.j: 日本刀では、刀によって先端の丸いものと円柱状の物があり、模様があることもある。
sen.e: Some Japanese swords have round head or cylindrical-shaped head, and some swords have a pattern.
Regarding Japanese swords, there are two types of tsuka-gashira: round head and cylindrical-shaped head, and some of them have a pattern.

sen.j: これも刀によって違い、模様自体無いことも多い。
sen.e: This varies from sword to sword and some swords even don't have a pattern.
It depends of the sword which type of tsuka-gashira it has, and there are many cases it has no pattern.

sen.j: 柄糸の結び目を覆うことで接触で解けることを防ぎ、美術的に不恰好な結び目を隠している。
sen.e: By covering the knot of tsuka-ito (the cord wrapping on a sword hilt), Tsuka-gashira prevents the knot from coming untied and helps to hide the visually not appealing knot.

sen.j: また、縁金と共に本来２つに分かれている柄を結束させる効果がある。
sen.e: Together with Fuchi-gane (the other end of a hilt), it has an effect to connect the hilt which originally consists of two parts.

sen.j: 縁金と違い、目釘を外して分解しても取ることはできない。
sen.e: Unlike Fuchi-gane, Tsuka-gashira cannot be removed by pulling Mekugi (peg) and taking a sword apart.
